name: Delicious Herbed Spinach and Kale Balls
author: algc09
summary: An old Weight Watchers® recipe with many modifications through the years. Delicious and nutritious. Kids love them!
ingredients: olive oil cooking spray (such as PAM®)
1 (16 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1 cup finely chopped onion, or more to taste
1 (16 ounce) package frozen kale, thawed and drained
¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or more to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray or line with parchment paper
Combine spinach, onion, 5 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, and eggs together in a large bowl
Add kale, bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, sea salt, garlic powder, thyme, sage, rosemary, oregano, and black pepper; mix thoroughly using your hands
Form mixture into 1 1/2-inch balls and arrange on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes; flip and continue baking until lightly browned, 10 to 20 more minutes
